text: was a 2G mailing and picture messaging service provided by J-Phone (now Softbank). The term derives from sha, the first part of the Japanese word , and mail (from email). In 2002 Vodafone, which had by that point acquired J-Phone, launched Vodafone live! as a global service. This led to the now- obsolete Sha-Mail never upgrading to 3G, effectively ending Sha-Mail once support for 2G networks ceased.
